arm_group.description: Performing liver transplantation under general anesthesia using sevoflurane
Performing liver transplantation under general anesthesia using desflurane

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to assess the effects of inhalation agent on corrected QT
      interval duration during liver transplantation.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Inhalation Agent on the QTc Interval During Liver Transplantation: Sub Study (NCT01886664)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  elective liver transplantation

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  age < 18, age > 65

          -  patient refusal

          -  re-transplantation

study_pop.textblock:
subjects who were enrolled prospectively in study (ClinicalTrials.gov Identifier
        NCT01886664)

primary_outcome.description: up to 10 minutes after tracheal intubation, up to 60 minutes after reperfusion, at 10 minutes after hepatectomy, at 10 minutes after biliary anastomosis, at skin closure, at the arrival on ICU, on postoperative day 1.
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to postoperative day 1 after surgery

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: proportion of patients whose QTc interval is more than 450 ms for men and 470 ms for women
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to postoperative day 1 after surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: proportion of patients who have more than 500 ms of QTc interval
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to postoperative day 1 after surgery

secondary_outcome.description: up to 10 minutes after tracheal intubation, up to 60 minutes after reperfusion, at 10 minutes after hepatectomy, at 10 minutes after biliary anastomosis, at skin closure, at the arrival on ICU, on postoperative day 1.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to postoperative day 1 after surgery

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
